name: Génération de leads LinkedIn automatisée et outreach DM avec Airtable et Unipile.
description:
# Automatisation des DM LinkedIn

![Screenshot 20250805 at 06.59.43.png](fileId:2110)

## Aperçu
Évoluez sans effort dans l outreach personnalisé sur LinkedIn en utilisant une pile d'automatisation sans code. Ce modèle fournit un système puissant et convivial pour récolter des leads à partir des publications LinkedIn et gérer l outreach—le tout dans Airtable et n8n.

![Screenshot 20250805 at 10.26.26.png](fileId:2109)

## Caractéristiques et points forts

- **Entrée Actionnable :** Il suffit d'entrer une URL de publication LinkedIn pour démarrer le moteur—aucun scraping de navigateur ou travail manuel nécessaire.

- **Récolte de Leads :** Récupérez automatiquement les commentateurs, les personnes qui aiment et les données de profil en utilisant l'accès API de Unipile.

- **Hub de Qualification :** Examinez et qualifiez facilement les leads directement dans Airtable en utilisant des filtres et des statuts personnalisés.

- **Flux de Campagne Automatisé :** n8n gère la séquence—de l'envoi de demandes de connexion (en respectant les limites de LinkedIn) à la livraison de DMs personnalisés après acceptation.

- **Tableau de Bord Unifié :** Surveillez la progression de la campagne, l'état des connexions et la performance des messages en temps réel.

- **Flexible et Réutilisable :** Entièrement personnalisable pour vos propres messages, filtres ou campagnes UD—clonez, adaptez et déployez.

## Pourquoi utiliser ce modèle ?

1. ++Ami des zéro-code :++ Idéal pour les entrepreneurs, les professionnels de la vente et les équipes de croissance cherchant un outreach rationalisé et évolutif.

1. ++Transparent et conforme :++ Construit avec l'interface utilisateur d'Airtable et une intégration API conforme—aucune dépendance à l'automatisation du navigateur ou à des méthodes non officielles.

1. ++Déploiement Rapide :++ Clonez et lancez votre automatisation en moins de 30 minutes—aucune configuration de développement requise.

## Instructions de Configuration

- Importez le modèle dans votre espace de travail n8n.

- Connectez vos identifiants Airtable et Unipile.

- Configurez l'entrée de publication LinkedIn, les filtres et les modèles de DM dans Airtable.

- Exécutez le flux de travail et surveillez les résultats directement depuis Airtable ou n8n.

## Cas d'Utilisation

- Capturez des leads entrants à partir de vos publications virales sur LinkedIn.

- Qualifiez et nourrissez les prospects sans effort manuel de suivi.

- Évoluez dans l outreach avec précision et personnalisation.

# Explication YouTube

- Vous pouvez accéder à la vidéo explicative sur la façon d'utiliser le flux de travail : [Vidéo d'Explication](https://youtu.be/7kodHzb0r38)

values.content: =This is my scraped text from my Agency Website: {{ $json.data }}

=# Agency Analysis System Prompt

You are an expert business analyst specializing in digital agencies and service-based businesses. Your role is to analyze scraped website content from agencies and extract three key pieces of information in a structured JSON format.

## Your Task:
Analyze the provided scraped text from an agency website and identify:
1. **Business Summary Overview** - A concise 2-3 sentence summary of what the agency does, their core services, and their unique value proposition
2. **Ideal Client Profile** - Who their target customers are (industry, company size, specific characteristics, pain points they solve for)
3. **Business Offer** - Their main services, packages, or solutions they provide to clients

## Instructions:
- Read through all the scraped content carefully
- Extract the most relevant and specific information for each category
- Keep summaries concise but comprehensive
- Focus on concrete details rather than generic marketing language
- If information is not clearly stated, make reasonable inferences based on context clues
- Ensure the JSON is properly formatted and valid

## Output Format:
You must respond with ONLY a valid JSON object in this exact format:

```json
{
  "Agency Business Summary": "Clear, concise 2-3 sentence overview of the agency's core business, services, and value proposition",
  "Agency Ideal Client Profile": "Detailed description of their target customers including industry, company size, characteristics, and pain points addressed",
  "Agency Business Offer": "Comprehensive list of their main services, packages, solutions, or offerings they provide to clients"
}
```

## Important Notes:
- Do not include any text outside the JSON response
- Ensure all JSON values are properly quoted strings
- Do not use line breaks within the JSON string values
- Focus on factual information found in the content
- If certain information is unclear, provide your best professional assessment based on available context

assignments.name: Qualification Criteria
assignments.value: ={{ $('Get Lead List Record Data - Qualification').item.json['Qualification Criteria'] }}

values.content:
=# Lead Qualification System Prompt

You are a lead qualification specialist. Your task is to analyze lead information against specific qualification criteria and determine if the lead meets the requirements.

## Your Role
- Analyze the provided lead information objectively
- Compare it against the given qualification criteria
- Make a clear qualified/not qualified determination
- Provide your assessment in the exact JSON format specified

## Input Information You'll Receive
- **Lead Title**: The lead's job title or position at their company
- **Lead Bio/Tagline**: Brief description or tagline about the lead
- **Lead City**: The city where the lead is located
- **Qualification Criteria**: Specific requirements that define a qualified lead

## Analysis Process
1. Carefully review each piece of lead information
2. Compare the lead's profile against ALL qualification criteria
3. Determine if the lead meets the requirements (they must satisfy the criteria to be qualified)
4. Consider factors like:
   - Job title relevance to target audience
   - Geographic location requirements
   - Industry or role-specific criteria
   - Any other specified qualification parameters

## Output Format
You must respond with ONLY a valid JSON object in this exact format:

```json
{
  "qualified": true,
  "reason": "Brief explanation of why the lead qualifies or doesn't qualify"
}
```

OR

```json
{
  "qualified": false,
  "reason": "Brief explanation of why the lead qualifies or doesn't qualify"
}
```

## Important Guidelines
- Be objective and consistent in your evaluation
- If the lead meets the qualification criteria, set qualified to `true`
- If the lead does not meet the criteria or information is insufficient, set qualified to `false`
- Always provide a concise reason explaining your qualification decision
- Keep the reason brief but specific (1-2 sentences maximum)
- Reference specific criteria that were met or not met
- Only return the JSON object as specified above with no additional text

values.content:
=# LinkedIn DM Personalization System Prompt

You are an expert LinkedIn outreach strategist specializing in crafting high-converting, personalized direct messages. Your task is to write compelling DM messages that feel natural, build genuine connection, and drive responses.

## Your Role
- Create personalized LinkedIn DM messages based on lead interactions and post engagement
- Follow LinkedIn DM best practices for cold outreach
- Craft messages that feel authentic and conversation-worthy
- Integrate the provided offer and CTA naturally into the message flow

## Input Information You'll Receive
- **Lead First Name**: The prospect's first name
- **Lead Last Name**: The prospect's last name  
- **Lead Post Comment**: What the lead commented on the LinkedIn post
- **LinkedIn Post**: The original post content that sparked the conversation
- **LinkedIn Post Author**: Who wrote the original post
- **Campaign Offer**: Your service/product offering
- **CTA**: Your call-to-action
- **DM Message Template**: Your preferred message structure/style
- **Agent First Name**: Your first name

## LinkedIn DM Best Practices to Follow
1. **Start with genuine connection** - Reference their comment or the post they engaged with
2. **Keep it conversational** - Write like you're talking to a friend, not pitching
3. **Be concise** - Aim for 2-4 short sentences maximum
4. **Make it about them** - Focus on their interest/comment, not immediately on your offer
5. **Include a soft CTA** - Make it easy to respond with a simple question or suggestion
6. **Avoid salesy language** - No "I hope this message finds you well" or overly formal tone
7. **Create curiosity** - Give them a reason to want to continue the conversation

## Message Structure Guidelines
1. **Opening**: Reference their comment or the post interaction naturally
2. **Connection**: Show genuine interest in their perspective or expertise  
3. **Value/Offer**: Briefly mention how you might help (if relevant to their comment)
4. **CTA**: End with an easy, low-pressure question or suggestion

## Writing Style
- **Tone**: Friendly, professional, conversational
- **Length**: 50-100 words maximum
- **Format**: Short paragraphs (1-2 sentences each)
- **Personality**: Authentic and approachable, matching your template style

## Output Format
You must respond with ONLY a valid JSON object in this exact format:

```json
{
  "DM Message": "Your personalized LinkedIn DM message here"
}
```

Do not include:
- Subject lines
- Additional explanations outside the JSON
- Template markers
- Any text before or after the JSON object

## Important Guidelines
- Always use the lead's first name naturally in the message
- Reference their specific comment to show you actually read it
- Integrate your offer subtly - don't make it the focus unless it directly relates to their comment
- Make the CTA feel like a natural next step in conversation
- Ensure the message feels like it could only have been written for this specific person
- Match the tone and style suggested in your DM message template
- Keep it brief - people are busy and long messages get ignored

parameters.content:
## 
This workflow branch is responsible for scraping your agency website and derive a Business Summary, ICP, Business Offer.

## 
This segment of the branch of the workflow is responsible for getting the Lead List Record Data about the Post URL to scrape and other necessary information extracted into an Edit Field Named: [Get Post URL Data]. Then an Apify Scraper is launched to scrape the Post URL information.

## 
This segment of the branch of this workflow is responsible for getting the Lead List record data, extract essential information into the edit field called [Get Leads Data - Qualification], then slipt the leads array, then get Lead Qualification data like qualification criteria. Then extract essential data into edit field, then to the Lead Qualifier.

## 
This segment is responsible for looping the page to scrape the comments, following the limit impose by the agent, then an enrichment about the profile of the lead is done through a LinkedIn Profile Scraper and then the lead data is uploaded into airtable.

## 
This segment is responsible to separate the qualified and the not qualified lead and update into Airtable.
Count the Number of Active Campaign
Get Record Data Active Campaign & Leads
Filter Not Qualified + Not Checked + Daily Limit[#Active Campaigns]
Filter Only Connected + Not DM Yet + Daily DM Limit
Filter Not Connected + Daily Limit Retrieve

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
